This construction vehicle's position and size suggest it is engaged in work and presents a physical barrier, requiring the ego vehicle to either stop or maneuver around if safe to do so. Additionally, there are orange traffic cones visible just to the left of the construction vehicle, indicating a designated work zone and directing traffic to avoid the area. The cones are used to guide vehicles away from the construction area; the ego vehicle should heed this indication to change lanes or adjust its path accordingly. There are no vulnerable road users, traffic signs, traffic lights, barriers, or other objects present in the image.

The ego car should maintain a safe distance and be prepared for unexpected movements or stops related to construction activities.

The ego car should anticipate potential stops and be cautious when approaching or overtaking the bus, ensuring that there is enough space to do so safely and that it is ready to accommodate if the bus signals to merge back into traffic.

driving_suggestion: Reduce speed due to the snowy road conditions and be prepared to stop or cautiously maneuver around the construction vehicle if the adjacent lane is clear and it is safe to do so. Observe any road workers or additional signals they might provide for navigation around the work zone. Use caution due to potential slippery road conditions from the snow and ice, and maintain a safe following distance.
